description.narrative: Support and strengthen the negotiation process and implement peace and reconciliation processes, accords and ceasefire agreements at track levels 1, 2 and 3, including support to indigenous peacebuilding efforts. For a peace/negotiations process to have a chance of success, it must entail building trust in the process, between parties, and among their constituents, with a special focus on including women. Illustrative activities include negotiation training; platform development; public opinion polling; facilitation activities; elder statesmen engagement; provision of international expert advice and knowledge; financial support to parties; multi-stakeholder dialogues; assistance with the design of peacebuilding training programs; support and maintenance of agreed verification mechanisms; support to complaint tracking mechanisms; and work with local and national government representatives to bring them closer to their constituencies.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

title.narrative: USAID Communications, Utilities, and Rental Payments

description.narrative: Administrative costs and operating expenses of USAID contributing to Communications, Utilities, and Rental Payments.

title.narrative: UNDP Action for Cooperation Trust Programme (ACT)

description.narrative: UNDPs role in helping to address Cyprus conflict is unique in the organisations global experience. The Action for Cooperation Trust Programme (ACT) started in 2005 and succeeded the Bi-Communal Development Programme (BDP) which supported peace building efforts from 1998. Different phases of the ACT programme targeted the capacity of civil society to feed into the process of inter-communal reconciliation, and this UNDP support has responded to the growth of civic engagement priorities on the island. In the period 2005-2008 ACT created new spaces for citizen peace building in Cyprus, and was characterised by many small projects aimed at showing that inter-communal cooperation was possible. Starting in 2009 UNDP-ACT supported projects focussed on helping to prepare civil society to engage in the peace process and set the foundations for a durable process of reconciliation.

title.narrative: Sharing History, Art, Research and Education (SHARE) Global Development Alliance

description.narrative: The agreement will support the implementation of the pioneering Sharing History, Art, Research and Education (SHARE) initiative. SHARE is a partnership program between the Costas and Rita Severis Foundation, USAID, the Turkish Cypriot University Womens Association, and the NGO Support Center. The goal of SHARE is to provide a common platform for the exploration of the islands cultural heritage through various activities and through these to increase the potential for peaceful coexistence in Cyprus. The partners hope that SHARE will serve as a model for promoting and expanding bicommunal activity via local people and communities, local private sector business, non-governmental organizations and leading local and international academic institutions.

description.narrative: Provide goods, personnel, services and assistance to meet basic human needs in order to foster transition from relief according to principles of universality, impartiality and human dignity. This element should be done, when possible, as part of an integrated, coordinated and/or multi-sectoral approach.

title.narrative: Supporting Activities that Value the Environment (SAVE) Project

description.narrative: The purpose is to bolster activities in environmental and water management by providing resources to facilitate the introduction and implementation of land and land-use planning concepts, and tools.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: The Capacity Development Program (CDP) is designed to foster conditions for a durable settlement by providing economic development and other support to the Turkish Cypriot Community (TCC). The project complements USAID and other donor programs by addressing critical performance gaps that limit the capacity of the TCC to fully participate in future reconciliation and adoption of the acquis communautaire. The USAID/Cyprus Strategic Objective (SO) of strengthening the conditions that will foster a durable settlement is supported by two mutually reinforcing Intermediate Results (IRs). The first IR focuses on a strengthened culture of mutual understanding. The second IR addresses increased parity of economic opportunity. As a cross-cutting program, CDP complements and supports all other U.S. Government-funded programs by providing [to groups or individuals at targeted local institutions] capacity development opportunities in critical areas.

description.narrative: Conditions to foster a durable settlement are strengthened
